.method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Data.EstimatorChain`1<!!TTrans> AppendCacheCheckpoint<class (class Microsoft.ML.Core.Data.ITransformer) TTrans>(class Microsoft.ML.Core.Data.IEstimator`1<!!TTrans> start, class Microsoft.ML.Runtime.IHostEnvironment env) cil managed
<Extension()> Public Function AppendCacheCheckpoint(Of TTrans As {Class, ITransformer}) (start As IEstimator(Of TTrans), env As IHostEnvironment) As EstimatorChain(Of TTrans)

static member AppendCacheCheckpoint : Microsoft.ML.Core.Data.IEstimator<'rans (requires 'rans : null and 'rans :> Microsoft.ML.Core.Data.ITransformer)> * Microsoft.ML.Runtime.IHostEnvironment -> Microsoft.ML.Runtime.Data.EstimatorChain<'rans (requires 'rans : null and 'rans :> Microsoft.ML.Core.Data.ITransformer)> (requires 'rans : null and 'rans :> Microsoft.ML.Core.Data.ITransformer)

Docs.param: The host environment to use for caching.
Docs.summary: Append a 'caching checkpoint' to the estimator chain. This will ensure that the downstream estimators will be trained against cached data. It is helpful to have a caching checkpoint before trainers that take multiple data passes.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.ML.Core.Data.IEstimator<TTransformer> WithOnFitDelegate<TTransformer> (this Microsoft.ML.Core.Data.IEstimator<TTransformer> estimator, Action<TTransformer> onFit) where TTransformer : class, Microsoft.ML.Core.Data.ITransformer;

.method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.ML.Core.Data.IEstimator`1<!!TTransformer> WithOnFitDelegate<class (class Microsoft.ML.Core.Data.ITransformer) TTransformer>(class Microsoft.ML.Core.Data.IEstimator`1<!!TTransformer> estimator, class System.Action`1<!!TTransformer> onFit) cil managed
<Extension()> Public Function WithOnFitDelegate(Of TTransformer As {Class, ITransformer}) (estimator As IEstimator(Of TTransformer), onFit As Action(Of TTransformer)) As IEstimator(Of TTransformer)

static member WithOnFitDelegate : Microsoft.ML.Core.Data.IEstimator<'ransformer (requires 'ransformer : null and 'ransformer :> Microsoft.ML.Core.Data.ITransformer)> * Action<'ransformer (requires 'ransformer : null and 'ransformer :> Microsoft.ML.Core.Data.ITransformer)> -> Microsoft.ML.Core.Data.IEstimator<'ransformer (requires 'ransformer : null and 'ransformer :> Microsoft.ML.Core.Data.ITransformer)> (requires 'ransformer : null and 'ransformer :> Microsoft.ML.Core.Data.ITransformer)

Docs.param: The delegate that is called with the resulting instances once is called. Because may be called multiple times, this delegate may also be called multiple times.
Docs.summary: Given an estimator, return a wrapping object that will call a delegate once is called. It is often important for an estimator to return information about what was fit, which is why the method returns a specifically typed object, rather than just a general . However, at the same time, are often formed into pipelines with many objects, so we may need to build a chain of estimators via where the estimator for which we want to get the transformer is buried somewhere in this chain. For that scenario, we can through this method attach a delegate that will be called once fit is called.
Docs.returns: A wrapping estimator that calls the indicated delegate whenever fit is called
